intro: Symplocos ribes, commonly known as the red-fruited beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces showy, dark purple to black berries that ripen in the fall, attracting birds and other wildlife. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a glossy surface with serrated edges. Symplocos ribes thrives in partial shade to full sun and is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland habitats.
